{"step_by_step_thinking": "VLDL stands for Very Low-Density Lipoprotein. It is produced in the liver and its main function is to transport triglycerides (endogenous fats) from the liver to peripheral tissues. Therefore, it is not involved in the delivery of exogenous fats. It also carries a small amount of cholesterol, but its primary role is not the delivery of cholesterol.", "answer_choice": "A"}
